title: Mini-Course: American Art at the Art Institute
short_description: Six-week lecture series with in-gallery seminars
list_description: Six-week lecture series with in-gallery seminars
description:
>Six Saturdays, June 9-July 14
11:00-12:30
Ryan Learning Center
$153.65 SAIC Alumni, $184.45 AIC Members, $204.75 NonmembersPartake in lively in-gallery discussions and short lectures about art made for and in the United States from the colonial period to the 20th century. Gain insightful context for special exhibitions highlighting the work of Ivan Albright, John Singer Sargent, and Charles White. This program is offered as a noncredit course within the School of the Art Institute of Chicago’s Adult Continuing Education program. Register online or download the Adult Continuing Education Non-Credit Registration Form and do one of the following:Email it to cs@saic.eduFax it to (312) 629-6171Drop it off at 36 South Wabash Avenue, Suite 1201, Chicago, IL 60603

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
